meanings.definition: Something that persuades or influences someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The company offered various inducements to attract new customers.
meanings.sent2: She was tempted by the inducements of a higher salary and flexible hours.
meanings.sent3: The inducements to join the club included free snacks and fun activities.
meanings.sent4: The promise of a promotion acted as a powerful inducement for him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The colorful brochure highlighted all the enticing inducements of the vacation package.

meanings.definition: A benefit or reward offered to encourage a particular action.
meanings.sent1: The store provided loyalty points as inducements for customers to return.
meanings.sent2: The inducements of a bonus motivated the employees to meet their targets.
meanings.sent3: The inducements of free samples led to a surge in product sales.
meanings.sent4: The scholarship was a valuable inducement for students to excel in their studies.
meanings.sent5: The inducements of discounts and free shipping convinced her to make the purchase.
